Description: Fragment of shoulder of Milesian pottery closed vase, amphora or oenochoe. Edge of panel to left; tongues at top of shoulder panel; below, rhomboid ornament to left, pendent lotus flower to right.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leipzig, Institut für Klassische Archäologie und Antikenmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The sherd was lost in WWII. Cook (with reference to the sherd when still in Oxford) took it to be from the same vase as Cairo CG26152 and Boston, MFA 86.636. It does most probably belong with the Cairo sherds but not with that in Boston, which lacks the band of tongues.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.036)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: 1925.608b (Ashmolean exchange (not a unique number))
